title: About
text:
Welcome to the MoveNext blog!
MoveNext is a consulting company located in Toulouse, France. Our domains of expertise are Software Design and Development and Machine Learning.
These fields are constantly evolving, and it is essential to stay informed and share knowledge with other professionals in the industry.
We hope our articles will be helpful to you and that you can benefit from them in your daily work. Feel free to share your comments and suggestions with us; we are always open to discussions and exchanging ideas.
Thank you for reading us, and see you soon on our blog!
The MoveNext team.

title: Hello, World!
text:
This is the first post.

It has to be a start for every adventure. For software developers, it’s often just as simple as taking a cup of coffee and saying, “Hello, World!”. So here we are, and our journey begins.

title: Post With Code
text:
A test of the capability to display code in the blog.
This blog is authored and published with Quarto. Quarto is an open-source system specialized in technical and scientific publishing. With Quarto you can write your articles as Jupyter notebooks and then publish them as a website, pdf and/or docx documents.
The nice thing is that you can easily mix text, code, and the result of computations. Let’s see an example.

Example: Polar Axis
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()




Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis




And here is a screen shot of my IDE editing the source of this post.
